channel.title: Climate and Society
channel.description: Recent content on Climate and Society

item.title: A New Take on an Old Tradition
item.description: Oysters are an icon of Cape Cod. Tourists flock here in the summer to find the best shellfish in town, enjoy evenings at oyster bars, and even try their hand at oyster picking themselves. But the Falmouth Municipal Shellfish Propagation Program is giving these small animals a whole new life here, growing them to both control pollution and bolster local aquaculture industry. Christina Lovely of Falmouth Marine and Environmental Services at the Waquoit Bay field site Falmouthâ€™s nitrogen pollution problem is becoming worse as the population here grows.
